  <us-gaap:ImpairmentOrDisposalOfLongLivedAssetsPolicyTextBlock 
id="ImpairmentOrDisposalOfLongLivedAssetsPolicyTextBlock.992.0.0.0.0.0.0" 
contextRef="from-2013-01-01-to-2013-06-30.992.0.0.0.0.0.0.0">&lt;!--DOCTYPE html
PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" 
"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd" --&gt;&lt;div&gt; 
&lt;div&gt;&lt;!--StartFragment--&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold;
MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
Impairment of Long-Lived Assets&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; 
text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The Fund reviews the value of its oil
and gas properties whenever management determines that events and circumstances 
indicate that the recorded carrying value of properties may not be recoverable. 
Impairments of proved properties are determined by comparing future net 
undiscounted cash flows to the net book value at the time of the review. If the 
net book value exceeds the future net undiscounted cash flows, the carrying 
value of the property is written down to fair value, which is determined using 
net discounted future cash flows from the property. The Fund provides for 
impairments on unproved properties when it determines that the property will not
be developed or a permanent impairment in value has occurred. The fair value 
determinations require considerable judgment and are sensitive to change. 
Different pricing assumptions, reserve estimates or discount rates could result 
in a different calculated impairment. Given the volatility of oil and natural 
gas prices, it is reasonably possible that the Fund&amp;#39;s estimate of 
discounted future net cash flows from proved oil and natural gas reserves could 
change in the near term. If oil and natural gas prices decline significantly, 
even if only for a short period of time, it is possible that write-downs of oil 
and gas properties could occur.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; 
text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; During the three and six months ended
June 30, 2012, the Fund recorded an impairment of&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;$1.9 
million, relating to the Alpha Project, which was attributable to revisions to 
reserve estimates. The fair value at the date of impairment was $1.5 
million.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Such amount was determined based on level 3 inputs, 
which included projected income from reserves utilizing forward price curves, 
net of anticipated costs, discounted. There were no impairments to oil and gas 
properties for the three and six months ended June 30, 2013.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div
style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify;
TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;!--EndFragment--
&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:ImpairmentOrDisposalOfLongLivedAssetsPolicyTextBlock>

--&gt;&lt;div&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;!--StartFragment--&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY:

INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Income Taxes&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; 
text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; No provision is made for income taxes
in the financial statements.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Fund is a limited liability 
company, and as such, the Fund&amp;#39;s income or loss is passed through and 
included in the tax returns of the Fund&amp;#39;s shareholders.&lt;/div&gt;

  <us-gaap:NetCashProvidedByUsedInFinancingActivities 
id="NetCashProvidedByUsedInFinancingActivities.993.0.0.0.0.0.0" 
contextRef="from-2012-01-01-to-2012-06-30.993.0.0.0.0.0.0.0" unitRef="USD"

  <us-
gaap:OrganizationConsolidationBasisOfPresentationBusinessDescriptionAndAccountin
gPoliciesTextBlock 
id="OrganizationConsolidationBasisOfPresentationBusinessDescriptionAndAccounting
PoliciesTextBlock.992.0.0.0.0.0.0" contextRef="from-2013-01-01-to-2013-06-
30.992.0.0.0.0.0.0.0">&lt;!--DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 
Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd" 
--&gt;&lt;div&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;!--StartFragment--&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: 
block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt; &lt;table style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0"&gt; &lt;tr 
valign="top"&gt; &lt;td style="WIDTH: 36pt" align="right"&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 1.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td align="left"&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; 
TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Organization and Summary of Significant Accounting 
Policies&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div
style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-
align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Organization&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The 
Ridgewood Energy O Fund, LLC (the "Fund"), a Delaware limited liability company,
was formed on December 21, 2004 and operates pursuant to a limited liability 
company agreement (the "LLC Agreement") dated as of February 16, 2005 by and 
among Ridgewood Energy Corporation (the "Manager") and the shareholders of the 
Fund, which addresses matters such as the authority and voting rights of the 
Manager and shareholders, capitalization, transferability of membership 
interests, participation in costs and revenues, distribution of assets and 
dissolution and winding up.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Fund was organized to 
primarily acquire interests in oil and gas properties located in the United 
States offshore waters of Texas, Louisiana and Alabama in the Gulf of 
Mexico.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-
RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
The Manager has direct and exclusive control over the management of the 
Fund&amp;#39;s operations.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;With respect to project 
investments, the Manager locates potential projects, conducts due diligence, and
negotiates and completes the transactions in which the investments are 
made.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Manager performs, or arranges for the performance 
of, the management, advisory and administrative services required for Fund 
operations.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Such services include, without limitation, the 
administration of shareholder accounts, shareholder relations and the 
preparation, review and dissemination of tax and other financial
information.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In addition, the Manager provides office space, 
equipment and facilities and other services necessary for Fund 
operations.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Manager also engages and manages the 
contractual relations with unaffiliated custodians, depositories, accountants, 
attorneys, broker-dealers, corporate fiduciaries, insurers, banks and others as 
required. See Notes 3, 4 and 5.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt;
MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Basis of 
Presentation&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: 
justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; These unaudited interim condensed financial 
statements have been prepared by the Fund&amp;#39;s management in accordance 
with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America 
("GAAP") and in the opinion of management, contain all adjustments (consisting 
of only normal recurring adjustments) necessary to present fairly the 
Fund&amp;#39;s financial position, results of operations and cash flows for the 
periods presented.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Certain information and note disclosures 
normally included in annual financial statements prepared in accordance with 
GAAP have been omitted in these unaudited interim condensed financial 
statements.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The results of operations, financial position, 
and cash flows for the periods presented herein are not necessarily indicative 
of future financial results.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;These unaudited interim 
condensed financial statements should be read in conjunction with the 
Fund&amp;#39;s December 31, 2012 financial statements and notes thereto included
in the Fund&amp;#39;s Annual Report on Form 10-K filed with the Securities and 
Exchange Commission ("SEC").&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The year-end condensed balance 
sheet data was derived from audited financial statements, but does not include 
all disclosures required by GAAP.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt; Use of Estimates&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; 
text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The preparation of financial 
statements in accordance with GAAP requires management to make estimates and 
assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and 
disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities as of the date of the financial 
statements and the reported amounts of revenue and expense during the reporting 
period. On an ongoing basis, the Manager reviews its estimates, including those 
related to the fair value of financial instruments, property balances, 
determination of proved reserves, impairments and asset retirement obligations. 
Actual results may differ from those estimates.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-
align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Fair Value Measurements&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
The fair value measurement guidance provides a hierarchy that prioritizes and 
defines the types of inputs used to measure fair value.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The 
fair value hierarchy gives the highest priority to Level 1 inputs, which 
consists of unadjusted quoted prices for identical instruments in active 
markets.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Level 2 inputs consist of quoted prices for similar 
instruments.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Level 3 valuations are derived from inputs that 
are significant and unobservable; hence, these valuations have the lowest 
priority.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Cash and cash equivalents and held-to-maturity 
investments approximate fair value based on Level 1 
inputs.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Mortgage-backed securities are recorded based on 
Level 2 inputs, as such instruments trade in over-the-counter 
markets.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: 
justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY:
block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Cash and Cash Equivalents&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: 
block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-
RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; All highly liquid 
investments with maturities, when purchased, of three months or less, are 
considered cash and cash equivalents. At times, deposits may be in excess of 
federally insured limits, which are $250 thousand per insured financial 
institution.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;At June 30, 2013, the Fund&amp;#39;s bank 
balances exceeded federally insured limits by $11.1 million, of which $2.5 
million was invested in money market accounts that invest solely in U.S. 
Treasury bills and notes.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt;
MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Salvage 
Fund&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The Fund deposits in a separate interest-bearing account, or 
salvage fund, money to provide for the dismantling and removal of production 
platforms and facilities and plugging
 and abandoning its wells at the end of their useful lives in accordance with 
applicable federal and state laws and regulations. At June 30, 2013 and December
31, 2012, &lt;font style="DISPLAY: inline"&gt;the Fund had investments in 
federal agency mortgage-backed securities within its salvage fund that are 
classified as available-for-sale of $0.5 million and $0.8 million, respectively,
which mature in&lt;/font&gt; January 2042.&lt;font style="DISPLAY: 
inline"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Available-for-sale securities are carried in the 
financial statements at fair value.&lt;/font&gt; &lt;font style="DISPLAY: 
inline"&gt;At June 30, 2013 and December 31, 2012, there was no unrealized gain 
or loss related to the Fund&amp;#39;s available-for-sale 
investments.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; 
text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; At December 31, 2012, &lt;font 
style="DISPLAY: inline"&gt;the Fund had investments in U.S. Treasury securities 
within its salvage fund that are classified as held-to-maturity of $0.2 million,
which matured in June&lt;/font&gt; 2013.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Held-to-maturity 
investments are those securities that the Fund has the ability and intent to 
hold until maturity, and are recorded at cost plus accrued income, adjusted for 
the amortization of premiums and discounts, which approximates fair 
value.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt"&gt; For all investments, interest income is accrued as earned and 
amortization of premium or discount, if any, is included in interest 
income.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Interest earned on the account will become part of 
the salvage fund. There are no restrictions on withdrawals from the salvage 
fund.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; 
MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Debt Discounts and
Deferred Financing Costs&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-
align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Debt discounts and deferred financing 
costs include lender fees and other costs of the credit agreement such as the 
conveyance of override royalty interests related to the Beta 
Project.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;These costs are deferred and amortized over the term
of the debt period or until the redemption of the debt and are included on the 
balance sheet within "Other assets".&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;At June 30, 2013 and 
December 31, 2012, $1.6 million and $1.8 million of debt discounts and deferred 
financing costs were unamortized.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Amortization expense was 
$0.1 million and $0.2 million during the three and six months ended June 30, 
2013, respectively.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;There was no amortization expense during
the three and six months ended June 30, 2012.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;During the 
period of asset construction, amortization expense, as a component of interest, 
is capitalized and included on the balance sheet within "Oil and gas 
properties".&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Oil and
Gas Properties&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: 
justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The Fund invests in oil and gas properties, which
are operated by unaffiliated entities that are responsible for drilling, 
administering and producing activities pursuant to the terms of the applicable 
operating agreements with working interest owners. The Fund&amp;#39;s portion of
exploration, drilling, operating and capital equipment expenditures is billed by
operators.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-
align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Exploration, development and acquisition 
costs are accounted for using the successful efforts method. Costs of acquiring 
unproved and proved oil and natural gas leasehold acreage, including lease 
bonuses, brokers&amp;#39; fees and other related costs are capitalized. Costs of
drilling and equipping productive wells and related production facilities are 
capitalized. Costs of developing production facilities and pipelines that 
service multiple oil and gas properties are segregated as "Equipment and 
facilities - in progress."&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Exploratory costs are capitalized 
pending determination of whether proved reserves have been found. If proved 
commercial reserves are not found, exploratory drilling costs are expensed as 
dry-hole costs. Annual lease rentals and exploration expenses are expensed as 
incurred.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;All costs related to production activity and 
workover efforts are expensed as incurred.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: 
block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: 
block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-
RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Upon the sale, retirement
or abandonment of a property, the cost and related accumulated depletion, 
depreciation, and amortization, if any, is eliminated from the property 
accounts, and the resultant gain or loss is recognized.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; At June
30, 2013 and December 31, 2012, amounts recorded in due to operators totaling 
$1.5 million and $0.8 million, respectively, related to capital expenditures for
oil and gas properties.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
Advances to Operators for Working Interests and Expenditures&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The 
Fund&amp;#39;s acquisition of a working interest in a well or a project requires
it to make a payment to the seller for the Fund&amp;#39;s rights, title and 
interest.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Fund may be required to advance its share of 
estimated cash expenditures for the succeeding month&amp;#39;s 
operation.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Fund accounts for such payments as advances to
operators for working interests and expenditures.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As drilling
costs are incurred, the advances are reclassified to unproved or proved 
properties.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-
RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; 
text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Asset Retirement 
Obligations&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: 
justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; For oil and gas properties, there are obligations
to perform removal and remediation activities when the properties are retired.
When a project reaches drilling depth and is determined to be either proved or 
dry, an asset retirement obligation is incurred. Plug and abandonment costs 
associated with unsuccessful projects are expensed as dry-hole 
costs.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As indicated above, the Fund maintains a salvage fund 
to provide for the funding of future asset retirement obligations.&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; 
text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Syndication Costs&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
Syndication costs are direct costs incurred by the Fund in connection with the 
offering of the Fund&amp;#39;s shares, including professional fees, selling 
expenses and administrative costs payable to the Manager, an affiliate of the 
Manager and unaffiliated broker-dealers, which are reflected on the 
Fund&amp;#39;s balance sheet as a reduction of shareholders&amp;#39; 
capital.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Revenue
Recognition and Imbalances&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; 
text-align: justify;
 TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Oil and gas revenues are recognized when oil and gas is 
sold to a purchaser at a fixed or determinable price, when delivery has occurred
and title has transferred, and if collectability of the revenue is probable. The
Fund uses the sales method of accounting for gas production imbalances. The 
volumes of gas sold may differ from the volumes to which the Fund is entitled 
based on its interests in the properties. These differences create imbalances 
that are recognized as a liability only when the properties&amp;#39; estimated 
remaining reserves net to the Fund will not be sufficient to enable the 
underproduced owner to recoup its entitled share through production. The 
Fund&amp;#39;s recorded liability, if any, would be reflected in other 
liabilities. No receivables are recorded for those wells where the Fund has 
taken less than its share of production.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: 
block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: 
block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Derivative Instruments&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: 
block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-
RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The Fund may periodically
utilize derivative instruments to manage the price risk attributable to its oil 
and gas production.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Derivative instruments are carried on the
balance sheet at fair value and recorded as either an asset or 
liability.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Changes in the fair value of the derivatives are 
recorded currently in earnings unless specific hedge accounting criteria are 
met.&amp;nbsp; At this time, the Fund has elected not to use hedge accounting 
for its derivatives and, accordingly, the derivatives are marked-to-market each 
quarter with fair value gains and losses recognized currently as other income on
the statement of operations.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The estimated fair value of such
contracts is based upon various factors, including reported prices on the New 
York Mercantile Exchange ("NYMEX") and the Intercontinental Exchange ("ICE"), 
volatility, and the time value of options.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Fund 
recognizes all unrealized and realized gains and losses related to these 
contracts on a mark-to-market basis on the statement of operations within other 
income or loss. The related cash flow impact of the derivative activities are 
reflected as cash flows from operating activities on the statement of cash 
flows.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Fund actively monitors the creditworthiness of 
each counterparty and assesses the impact, if any, on its derivative 
positions.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;See 
Note&amp;nbsp;2.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;"Derivative Instruments".&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt;
text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Impairment of Long-Lived 
Assets&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The Fund reviews the value of its oil and gas properties 
whenever management determines that events and circumstances indicate that the 
recorded carrying value of properties may not be recoverable. Impairments of 
proved properties are determined by comparing future net undiscounted cash flows
to the net book value at the time of the review. If the net book value exceeds 
the future net undiscounted cash flows, the carrying value of the property is 
written down to fair value, which is determined using net discounted future cash
flows from the property. The Fund provides for impairments on unproved 
properties when it determines that the property will not be developed or a 
permanent impairment in value has occurred. The fair value determinations 
require considerable judgment and are sensitive to change. Different pricing 
assumptions, reserve estimates or discount rates could result in a different 
calculated impairment. Given the volatility of oil and natural gas prices, it is
reasonably possible that the Fund&amp;#39;s estimate of discounted future net 
cash flows from proved oil and natural gas reserves could change in the near 
term. If oil and natural gas prices decline significantly, even if only for a 
short period of time, it is possible that write-downs of oil and gas properties 
could occur.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-
align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; During the three and six months ended June
30, 2012, the Fund recorded an impairment of&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;$1.9 million, 
relating to the Alpha Project, which was attributable to revisions to reserve 
estimates. The fair value at the date of impairment was $1.5 
million.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Such amount was determined based on level 3 inputs, 
which included projected income from reserves utilizing forward price curves, 
net of anticipated costs, discounted. There were no impairments to oil and gas 
properties for the three and six months ended June 30, 2013.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div
style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify;
TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt; Depletion, Depreciation and Amortization&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
Depletion, depreciation and amortization of the cost of proved oil and gas 
properties are calculated using the units-of-production method.&amp;nbsp; Proved
developed reserves are used as the base for depleting capitalized costs 
associated with successful exploratory well costs, development costs and related
facilities. The sum of proved developed and proved undeveloped reserves is used 
as the base for depleting or amortizing leasehold acquisition costs. In certain 
circumstances, equipment and facilities costs are depreciated over the estimated
useful life of the asset.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold;
MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
Income Taxes&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: 
justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; No provision is made for income taxes in the 
financial statements.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Fund is a limited liability 
company, and as such, the Fund&amp;#39;s income or loss is passed through and 
included in the tax returns of the Fund&amp;#39;s shareholders.&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; 
text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Income and Expense 
Allocation&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: 
justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Profits and losses are allocated to shareholders 
and the Manager in accordance with the LLC agreement.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-
align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Distributions&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
Distributions to shareholders are allocated in proportion to the number of 
shares held.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Manager determines whether available cash 
from operations, as defined in the LLC Agreement, will be distributed. Such 
distributions are allocated 85% to the shareholders and 15% to the Manager, as 
required by the LLC Agreement.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: 
justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Available cash from dispositions, as defined in 
the LLC Agreement, will be paid 99% to shareholders and 1% to the Manager until 
the shareholders have received total distributions equal to their capital 
contributions.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;After shareholders have received distributions
equal to their capital contributions, 85% of available cash from dispositions 
will be distributed to shareholders and 15% to the Manager.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify;
TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt; Recent Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: 
block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New
 Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: 
justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The Fund has considered recent accounting 
pronouncements and believes that these recent pronouncements will not have a 
material effect on the Fund&amp;#39;s financial statements.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;!--
EndFragment--&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</us-

  <us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentPolicyTextBlock 
id="PropertyPlantAndEquipmentPolicyTextBlock.992.0.0.0.0.0.0" contextRef="from-
2013-01-01-to-2013-06-30.992.0.0.0.0.0.0.0">&lt;!--DOCTYPE html PUBLIC

"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd" --&gt;&lt;div&gt; 
&lt;div&gt;&lt;!--StartFragment--&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold;
MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
Depletion, Depreciation and Amortization&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: 
block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-
RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Depletion, depreciation 
and amortization of the cost of proved oil and gas properties are calculated 
using the units-of-production method.&amp;nbsp; Proved developed reserves are 
used as the base for depleting capitalized costs associated with successful 
exploratory well costs, development costs and related facilities. The sum of 
proved developed and proved undeveloped reserves is used as the base for 
depleting or amortizing leasehold acquisition costs. In certain circumstances, 
equipment and facilities costs are depreciated over the estimated useful life of
the asset.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;!--EndFragment--&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</us-

  <us-gaap:ProvedOilAndGasPropertySuccessfulEffortMethod 
id="ProvedOilAndGasPropertySuccessfulEffortMethod.986.0.0.0.0.0.0" 
contextRef="as-of-2013-06-30.986.0.0.0.0.0.0.0" unitRef="USD" decimals="-

  <us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock 
id="RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock.992.0.0.0.0.0.0" 
contextRef="from-2013-01-01-to-2013-06-30.992.0.0.0.0.0.0.0">&lt;!--DOCTYPE html

"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd" --&gt;&lt;div&gt; 
&lt;div&gt;&lt;!--StartFragment--&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
&lt;table style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman" cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0"&gt; &lt;tr valign="top"&gt; &lt;td 
style="WIDTH: 36pt" align="right"&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; 
MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
3.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td align="left"&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Related Parties&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; 
&lt;/table&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-
align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The LLC Agreement provides that the 
Manager render management, administrative and advisory services to the 
Fund.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;For such services, the Manager is paid an annual 
management fee, payable monthly, of 2.5% of total capital contributions, net of 
cumulative dry-hole and related well costs incurred by the 
Fund.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Management fees for each of the three months ended June
30, 2013 and 2012 were $0.4 million.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Management fees for each
of the six months ended June 30, 2013 and 2012 were $0.8 million.&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
The Manager is entitled to receive a 15% interest in cash distributions from 
operations made by the Fund.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Distributions paid to the 
Manager for the three and six months ended June 30, 2013 were $0.1 million and 
$0.2 million, respectively.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Distributions paid to the Manager
for the three and six months ended June 30, 2012 were $0.3 million and $0.6 
million, respectively.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-
align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; At times, short-term payables and 
receivables, which do not bear interest, arise from transactions with affiliates
in the ordinary course of business.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; None of the amounts paid to the 
Manager have been derived as a result of arm&amp;#39;s length 
negotiations.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; 
MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: 
justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The Fund has working interest ownership in 
certain projects to acquire and develop oil and natural gas projects with other 
entities that are likewise managed by the Manager.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; In 
November 2012, the Fund entered into a credit agreement along with other 
entities managed by the Manager.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;!--EndFragment--
&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock>

  <us-gaap:RevenueRecognitionPolicyTextBlock 
id="RevenueRecognitionPolicyTextBlock.992.0.0.0.0.0.0" contextRef="from-2013-01-
01-to-2013-06-30.992.0.0.0.0.0.0.0">&lt;!--DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD 
XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-
transitional.dtd" --&gt;&lt;div&gt; &lt;div&gt;&lt;!--StartFragment--&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; 
text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Revenue Recognition and 
Imbalances&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: 
justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Oil and gas revenues are recognized when oil and 
gas is sold to a purchaser at a fixed or determinable price, when delivery has 
occurred and title has transferred, and if collectability of the revenue is 
probable. The Fund uses the sales method of accounting for gas production 
imbalances. The volumes of gas sold may differ from the volumes to which the 
Fund is entitled based on its interests in the properties. These differences 
create imbalances that are recognized as a liability only when the 
properties&amp;#39; estimated remaining reserves net to the Fund will not be 
sufficient to enable the underproduced owner to recoup its entitled share 
through production. The Fund&amp;#39;s recorded liability, if any, would be 
reflected in other liabilities. No receivables are recorded for those wells 
where the Fund has taken less than its share of production.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;!--
EndFragment--&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:RevenueRecognitionPolicyTextBlock>
  <us-gaap:StockholdersEquity id="StockholdersEquity.986.0.0.0.0.0.0"

&lt;div&gt;&lt;!--StartFragment--&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold;

Use of Estimates&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times 
New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: 
justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The preparation of financial statements in 
accordance with GAAP requires management to make estimates and assumptions that 
affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of 
contingent assets and liabilities as of the date of the financial statements and
the reported amounts of revenue and expense during the reporting period. On an 
ongoing basis, the Manager reviews its estimates, including those related to the
fair value of financial instruments, property balances, determination of proved
reserves, impairments and asset retirement obligations. Actual results may 
differ from those estimates.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;!--EndFragment--&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;div&gt;&lt;!--StartFragment--&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
&lt;table style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman" cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0"&gt; &lt;tr valign="top"&gt; &lt;td 
style="WIDTH: 36pt" align="right"&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; 
MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
3.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td align="left"&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Related Parties&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; 
&lt;/table&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-
align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The LLC Agreement provides that the 
Manager render management, administrative and advisory services to the 
Fund.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;For such services, the Manager is paid an annual 
management fee, payable monthly, of 2.5% of total capital contributions, net of 
cumulative dry-hole and related well costs incurred by the 
Fund.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Management fees for each of the three months ended June
30, 2013 and 2012 were $0.4 million.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Management fees for each
of the six months ended June 30, 2013 and 2012 were $0.8 million.&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
The Manager is entitled to receive a 15% interest in cash distributions from 
operations made by the Fund.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Distributions paid to the 
Manager for the three and six months ended June 30, 2013 were $0.1 million and 
$0.2 million, respectively.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Distributions paid to the Manager
for the three and six months ended June 30, 2012 were $0.3 million and $0.6 
million, respectively.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-
align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; At times, short-term payables and 
receivables, which do not bear interest, arise from transactions with affiliates
in the ordinary course of business.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; None of the amounts paid to the 
Manager have been derived as a result of arm&amp;#39;s length 
negotiations.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; 
MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: 
justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The Fund has working interest ownership in 
certain projects to acquire and develop oil and natural gas projects with other 
entities that are likewise managed by the Manager.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; In 
November 2012, the Fund entered into a credit agreement along with other 
entities managed by the Manager.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;!--EndFragment--
&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</NonNumbericText><FootnoteIndexer 
/><CurrencyCode /><CurrencySymbol 
/><IsIndependantCurrency>false</IsIndependantCurrency><ShowCurrencySymbol>false<
/ShowCurrencySymbol><DisplayDateInUSFormat>false</DisplayDateInUSFormat></Cell><
/Cells><ElementDataType>nonnum:textBlockItemType</ElementDataType><SimpleDataTyp
e>na</SimpleDataType><ElementDefenition>The entire disclosure for related party 
transactions. Examples of related party transactions include transactions 
between (a) a parent company and its subsidiary; (b) subsidiaries of a common 
parent; (c) and entity and its principal owners; and (d) 
affiliates.</ElementDefenition><ElementReferences>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef

sRoundingLevel>UnKnown</SharesRoundingLevel><PerShareRoundingLevel>UnKnown</PerS
hareRoundingLevel><ExchangeRateRoundingLevel>UnKnown</ExchangeRateRoundingLevel>

ferredLabelRole>terseLabel</PreferredLabelRole><FootnoteIndexer /><Cells><Cell

UnitID=""><Id>1</Id><IsNumeric>false</IsNumeric><IsRatio>false</IsRatio><Display
ZeroAsNone>false</DisplayZeroAsNone><NumericAmount>0</NumericAmount><RoundedNume
ricAmount>0</RoundedNumericAmount><NonNumbericText>&lt;!--DOCTYPE html PUBLIC 
"-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" 
"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd" --&gt;&lt;div&gt; 
&lt;div&gt;&lt;!--StartFragment--&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
&lt;table style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman" cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0"&gt; &lt;tr valign="top"&gt; &lt;td 
style="WIDTH: 36pt" align="right"&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; 
MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
1.&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td align="left"&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Organization and Summary of Significant Accounting 
Policies&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div
style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-
align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Organization&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The 
Ridgewood Energy O Fund, LLC (the "Fund"), a Delaware limited liability company,
was formed on December 21, 2004 and operates pursuant to a limited liability 
company agreement (the "LLC Agreement") dated as of February 16, 2005 by and 
among Ridgewood Energy Corporation (the "Manager") and the shareholders of the 
Fund, which addresses matters such as the authority and voting rights of the 
Manager and shareholders, capitalization, transferability of membership 
interests, participation in costs and revenues, distribution of assets and 
dissolution and winding up.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Fund was organized to 
primarily acquire interests in oil and gas properties located in the United 
States offshore waters of Texas, Louisiana and Alabama in the Gulf of 
Mexico.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-
RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
The Manager has direct and exclusive control over the management of the 
Fund&amp;#39;s operations.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;With respect to project 
investments, the Manager locates potential projects, conducts due diligence, and
negotiates and completes the transactions in which the investments are 
made.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Manager performs, or arranges for the performance 
of, the management, advisory and administrative services required for Fund 
operations.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Such services include, without limitation, the 
administration of shareholder accounts, shareholder relations and the 
preparation, review and dissemination of tax and other financial 
information.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In addition, the Manager provides office space, 
equipment and facilities and other services necessary for Fund 
operations.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Manager also engages and manages the 
contractual relations with unaffiliated custodians, depositories, accountants,
attorneys, broker-dealers, corporate fiduciaries, insurers, banks and others as 
required. See Notes 3, 4 and 5.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt;
MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Basis of 
Presentation&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: 
justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; These unaudited interim condensed financial 
statements have been prepared by the Fund&amp;#39;s management in accordance 
with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America 
("GAAP") and in the opinion of management, contain all adjustments (consisting 
of only normal recurring adjustments) necessary to present fairly the 
Fund&amp;#39;s financial position, results of operations and cash flows for the 
periods presented.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Certain information and note disclosures 
normally included in annual financial statements prepared in accordance with 
GAAP have been omitted in these unaudited interim condensed financial 
statements.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The results of operations, financial position, 
and cash flows for the periods presented herein are not necessarily indicative 
of future financial results.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;These unaudited interim 
condensed financial statements should be read in conjunction with the 
Fund&amp;#39;s December 31, 2012 financial statements and notes thereto included
in the Fund&amp;#39;s Annual Report on Form 10-K filed with the Securities and 
Exchange Commission ("SEC").&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The year-end condensed balance 
sheet data was derived from audited financial statements, but does not include 
all disclosures required by GAAP.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt; Use of Estimates&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; 
text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The preparation of financial 
statements in accordance with GAAP requires management to make estimates and 
assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and 
disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities as of the date of the financial 
statements and the reported amounts of revenue and expense during the reporting 
period. On an ongoing basis, the Manager reviews its estimates, including those 
related to the fair value of financial instruments, property balances, 
determination of proved reserves, impairments and asset retirement obligations. 
Actual results may differ from those estimates.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-
align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Fair Value Measurements&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
The fair value measurement guidance provides a hierarchy that prioritizes and 
defines the types of inputs used to measure fair value.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The 
fair value hierarchy gives the highest priority to Level 1 inputs, which 
consists of unadjusted quoted prices for identical instruments in active 
markets.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Level 2 inputs consist of quoted prices for similar 
instruments.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Level 3 valuations are derived from inputs that 
are significant and unobservable; hence, these valuations have the lowest 
priority.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Cash and cash equivalents and held-to-maturity 
investments approximate fair value based on Level 1 
inputs.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Mortgage-backed securities are recorded based on 
Level 2 inputs, as such instruments trade in over-the-counter 
markets.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: 
justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: 
block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Cash and Cash Equivalents&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: 
block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-
RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; All highly liquid 
investments with maturities, when purchased, of three months or less, are 
considered cash and cash equivalents. At times, deposits may be in excess of 
federally insured limits, which are $250 thousand per insured financial 
institution.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;At June 30, 2013, the Fund&amp;#39;s bank 
balances exceeded federally insured limits by $11.1 million, of which $2.5 
million was invested in money market accounts that invest
 solely in U.S. Treasury bills and notes.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: 
block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Salvage
Fund&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The Fund deposits in a separate interest-bearing account, or 
salvage fund, money to provide for the dismantling and removal of production 
platforms and facilities and plugging and abandoning its wells at the end of 
their useful lives in accordance with applicable federal and state laws and 
regulations. At June 30, 2013 and December 31, 2012, &lt;font style="DISPLAY: 
inline"&gt;the Fund had investments in federal agency mortgage-backed securities
within its salvage fund that are classified as available-for-sale of $0.5 
million and $0.8 million, respectively, which mature in&lt;/font&gt; January 
2042.&lt;font style="DISPLAY: inline"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Available-for-sale 
securities are carried in the financial statements at fair value.&lt;/font&gt; 
&lt;font style="DISPLAY: inline"&gt;At June 30, 2013 and December 31, 2012, 
there was no unrealized gain or loss related to the Fund&amp;#39;s available-
for-sale investments.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; At December 31, 2012, &lt;font 
style="DISPLAY: inline"&gt;the Fund had investments in U.S. Treasury securities 
within its salvage fund that are classified as held-to-maturity of $0.2 million,
which matured in June&lt;/font&gt; 2013.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Held-to-maturity 
investments are those securities that the Fund has the ability and intent to 
hold until maturity, and are recorded at cost plus accrued income, adjusted for 
the amortization of premiums and discounts, which approximates fair 
value.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt"&gt; For all investments, interest income is accrued as earned and 
amortization of premium or discount, if any, is included in interest 
income.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Interest earned on the account will become part of 
the salvage fund. There are no restrictions on withdrawals from the salvage 
fund.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; 
MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Debt Discounts and
Deferred Financing Costs&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-
align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Debt discounts and deferred financing 
costs include lender fees and other costs of the credit agreement such as the 
conveyance of override royalty interests related to the Beta 
Project.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;These costs are deferred and amortized over the term
of the debt period or until the redemption of the debt and are included on the 
balance sheet within "Other assets".&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;At June 30, 2013 and 
December 31, 2012, $1.6 million and $1.8 million of debt discounts and deferred 
financing costs were unamortized.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Amortization expense was 
$0.1 million and $0.2 million during the three and six months ended June 30, 
2013, respectively.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;There was no amortization expense during 
the three and six months ended June 30, 2012.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;During the 
period of asset construction, amortization expense, as a component of interest, 
is capitalized and included on the balance sheet within "Oil and gas 
properties".&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Oil and
Gas Properties&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: 
justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The Fund invests in oil and gas properties, which
are operated by unaffiliated entities that are responsible for drilling, 
administering and producing activities pursuant to the terms of the applicable 
operating agreements with working interest owners. The Fund&amp;#39;s portion of
exploration, drilling, operating and capital equipment expenditures is billed by
operators.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-
align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Exploration, development and acquisition 
costs are accounted for using the successful efforts method. Costs of acquiring 
unproved and proved oil and natural gas leasehold acreage, including lease 
bonuses, brokers&amp;#39; fees and other related costs are capitalized. Costs of
drilling and equipping productive wells and related production facilities are 
capitalized. Costs of developing production facilities and pipelines that 
service multiple oil and gas properties are segregated as "Equipment and 
facilities - in progress."&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Exploratory costs are capitalized 
pending determination of whether proved reserves have been found. If proved 
commercial reserves are not found, exploratory drilling costs are expensed as 
dry-hole costs. Annual lease rentals and exploration expenses are expensed as 
incurred.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;All costs related to production activity and 
workover efforts are expensed as incurred.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: 
block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: 
block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-
RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Upon the sale, retirement
or abandonment of a property, the cost and related accumulated depletion, 
depreciation, and amortization, if any, is eliminated from the property 
accounts, and the resultant gain or loss is recognized.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; At June
30, 2013 and December 31, 2012, amounts recorded in due to operators totaling 
$1.5 million and $0.8 million, respectively, related to capital expenditures for
oil and gas properties.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
Advances to Operators for Working Interests and Expenditures&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The 
Fund&amp;#39;s acquisition of a working interest in a well or a project requires
it to make a payment to the seller for the Fund&amp;#39;s rights, title and 
interest.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Fund may be required to advance its share of 
estimated cash expenditures for the succeeding month&amp;#39;s 
operation.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Fund accounts for such payments as advances to
operators for working interests and expenditures.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As drilling
costs are incurred, the advances are reclassified to unproved or proved 
properties.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-
RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; 
text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Asset Retirement 
Obligations&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: 
justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; For oil and gas properties, there are obligations
to perform removal and remediation activities when the properties are retired. 
When a project reaches drilling depth and is determined to be either proved or 
dry, an asset retirement obligation is incurred. Plug and abandonment costs 
associated with unsuccessful projects are expensed as dry-hole 
costs.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As indicated above, the Fund maintains a salvage fund 
to provide for the funding of future asset retirement obligations.&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; 
text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Syndication Costs&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
Syndication costs are direct costs incurred by the Fund in connection with the 
offering of the Fund&amp;#39;s
 shares, including professional fees, selling expenses and administrative costs 
payable to the Manager, an affiliate of the Manager and unaffiliated broker-
dealers, which are reflected on the Fund&amp;#39;s balance sheet as a reduction 
of shareholders&amp;#39; capital.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt; Revenue Recognition and Imbalances&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: 
block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-
RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Oil and gas revenues are 
recognized when oil and gas is sold to a purchaser at a fixed or determinable 
price, when delivery has occurred and title has transferred, and if 
collectability of the revenue is probable. The Fund uses the sales method of 
accounting for gas production imbalances. The volumes of gas sold may differ 
from the volumes to which the Fund is entitled based on its interests in the 
properties. These differences create imbalances that are recognized as a 
liability only when the properties&amp;#39; estimated remaining reserves net to 
the Fund will not be sufficient to enable the underproduced owner to recoup its 
entitled share through production. The Fund&amp;#39;s recorded liability, if 
any, would be reflected in other liabilities. No receivables are recorded for 
those wells where the Fund has taken less than its share of 
production.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
Derivative Instruments&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-
align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The Fund may periodically utilize 
derivative instruments to manage the price risk attributable to its oil and gas 
production.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Derivative instruments are carried on the balance
sheet at fair value and recorded as either an asset or 
liability.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Changes in the fair value of the derivatives are 
recorded currently in earnings unless specific hedge accounting criteria are 
met.&amp;nbsp; At this time, the Fund has elected not to use hedge accounting 
for its derivatives and, accordingly, the derivatives are marked-to-market each 
quarter with fair value gains and losses recognized currently as other income on
the statement of operations.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The estimated fair value of such
contracts is based upon various factors, including reported prices on the New 
York Mercantile Exchange ("NYMEX") and the Intercontinental Exchange ("ICE"), 
volatility, and the time value of options.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Fund 
recognizes all unrealized and realized gains and losses related to these 
contracts on a mark-to-market basis on the statement of operations within other 
income or loss. The related cash flow impact of the derivative activities are 
reflected as cash flows from operating activities on the statement of cash 
flows.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Fund actively monitors the creditworthiness of 
each counterparty and assesses the impact, if any, on its derivative 
positions.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;See 
Note&amp;nbsp;2.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;"Derivative Instruments".&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; 
text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Impairment of Long-Lived 
Assets&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The Fund reviews the value of its oil and gas properties 
whenever management determines that events and circumstances indicate that the
recorded carrying value of properties may not be recoverable. Impairments of 
proved properties are determined by comparing future net undiscounted cash flows
to the net book value at the time of the review. If the net book value exceeds 
the future net undiscounted cash flows, the carrying value of the property is 
written down to fair value, which is determined using net discounted future cash
flows from the property. The Fund provides for impairments on unproved 
properties when it determines that the property will not be developed or a 
permanent impairment in value has occurred. The fair value determinations 
require considerable judgment and are sensitive to change. Different pricing 
assumptions, reserve estimates or discount rates could result in a different 
calculated impairment. Given the volatility of oil and natural gas prices, it is
reasonably possible that the Fund&amp;#39;s estimate of discounted future net 
cash flows from proved oil and natural gas reserves could change in the near 
term. If oil and natural gas prices decline significantly, even if only for a 
short period of time, it is possible that write-downs of oil and gas properties 
could occur.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-
align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; During the three and six months ended June
30, 2012, the Fund recorded an impairment of&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;$1.9 million, 
relating to the Alpha Project, which was attributable to revisions to reserve 
estimates. The fair value at the date of impairment was $1.5 
million.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Such amount was determined based on level 3 inputs, 
which included projected income from reserves utilizing forward price curves, 
net of anticipated costs, discounted. There were no impairments to oil and gas 
properties for the three and six months ended June 30, 2013.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div
style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify;
TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt; Depletion, Depreciation and Amortization&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
Depletion, depreciation and amortization of the cost of proved oil and gas 
properties are calculated using the units-of-production method.&amp;nbsp; Proved
developed reserves are used as the base for depleting capitalized costs 
associated with successful exploratory well costs, development costs and related
facilities. The sum of proved developed and proved undeveloped reserves is used 
as the base for depleting or amortizing leasehold acquisition costs. In certain 
circumstances, equipment and facilities costs are depreciated over the estimated
useful life of the asset.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-
INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold;
MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
Income Taxes&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: 
justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; No provision is made for income taxes in the 
financial statements.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Fund is a limited liability 
company, and as such, the Fund&amp;#39;s income or loss is passed through and 
included in the tax returns of the Fund&amp;#39;s shareholders.&lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; 
&lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; 
text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Income and Expense 
Allocation&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: 
justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Profits and losses are allocated to shareholders 
and the Manager in accordance with the LLC agreement.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-
align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Distributions&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-
LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt;
Distributions to shareholders are allocated in proportion to the number of 
shares held.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Manager determines whether available cash 
from operations, as defined in the LLC Agreement, will be distributed. Such 
distributions are allocated 85% to the shareholders and 15% to the Manager, as 
required by the LLC Agreement.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; 
&amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: 
justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; Available cash from dispositions, as defined in 
the LLC Agreement, will be paid 99% to shareholders and 1% to the Manager until
 the shareholders have received total distributions equal to their capital 
contributions.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;After shareholders have received distributions
equal to their capital contributions, 85% of available cash from dispositions 
will be distributed to shareholders and 15% to the Manager.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div 
style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify;
TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; &amp;nbsp;&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt; Recent Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: 
block; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-
RIGHT: 0pt; text-align: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"&gt; The Fund has considered 
recent accounting pronouncements and believes that these recent pronouncements 
will not have a material effect on the Fund&amp;#39;s financial 
statements.&lt;/div&gt; &lt;div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;br /&gt; &lt;/div&gt; &lt;!--EndFragment--&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
<tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>The fees paid to the Manager of the Fund for the management 
of the Fund.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: 
none;">
                <p>No definition available.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ Details</a><div style="display: none;">
                <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
                  <tr>
                    <td><strong> Name:</strong></td>
                    <td><nobr>cik1315061_ManagementFeesToAffiliate</nobr></td>
                  </tr>
                  <tr>
                    <td style="padding-right: 4px;"><nobr><strong> Namespace 
Prefix:</strong></nobr></td>
                    <td>cik1315061_</td>
                  </tr>
                  <tr>
                    <td><strong> Data Type:</strong></td>
                    <td>xbrli:monetaryItemType</td>
                  </tr>
                  <tr>
                    <td><strong> Balance Type:</strong></td>
                    <td>debit</td>
